episode.title: The Contact
episode.description: The story begins. In 1981, three seekers made contact with an intelligence claiming to be from Venus. This is how it happened—and why it matters.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.text: January 15th, 1981. Louisville Kentucky. A small group gathered in a modest living room, as they had many times before. But this time, something different happened. Over the next three years, this group would produce over a hundred sessions of channeled material. Material that would challenge everything we think we know about consciousness, reality, and our place in the universe.
content.next_text: This is Distortion Check: The Ra Material.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.text: This is Distortion Check: The Ra Material.
content.previous_text: January 15th, 1981. Louisville, Kentucky. A small group gathered in a modest living room, as they had many times before. But this time, something different happened.
content.next_text: Alright, so here's the thing.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Welcome everyone, thanks for joining us as we discuss one of the most fascinating—and controversial—channeled texts ever recorded. I'm Victor, and I'm here with my friend Lenny. We've been geeking out over sci-fi, metaphysics, and the nature of reality for... what, like twenty years now?
content.previous_text: This is Distortion Check: The Ra Material.
content.next_text: At least. Probably longer if you count that time we stayed up all night arguing about The Matrix.

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: At least. Probably longer if you count all those times we stayed up all night arguing after watching Matrix for the Umpteenth time.
content.previous_text: I'm Victor, and this is my friend Lenny. We've been geeking out over sci-fi, metaphysics, and the nature of reality for... what, like twenty years now?
content.next_text: Jeez. That was back in our college days. Good times.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Jeez. That was back in our college days. Good times. Anyway, a short while ago, I stumbled across something called the Ra Material—also known as The Law of One. And it stopped me cold.
content.previous_text: At least. Probably longer if you count that time we stayed up all night arguing about The Matrix.
content.next_text: Stopped you cold? That's saying something.

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: Stopped you cold? That's saying something. You don't stop easy.
content.previous_text: Anyway, a short while ago, I stumbled across something called the Ra Material—also known as The Law of One. And it stopped me cold.
content.next_text: I don't. But this was different.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: I don't. But this was different. It's a collection of 106 channeling sessions conducted between 1981 and 1984. Three people—Don Elkins, Carla Rueckert, and Jim McCarty—made contact with an intelligence calling itself Ra. And Ra claimed to be a sixth-density social memory complex from Venus.
content.previous_text: Stopped you cold? That's saying something. You don't stop easy.
content.next_text: Okay, hold up. Sixth-density social memory complex? You're gonna have to unpack that.

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: Okay, hold up. Sixth-density social memory complex? You're gonna have to unpack that. And Venus? Like, the planet that's hot enough to melt lead?
content.previous_text: Three people—Don Elkins, Carla Rueckert, and Jim McCarty—made contact with an intelligence calling itself Ra. And Ra claimed to be a sixth-density social memory complex from Venus.
content.next_text: Yeah, we'll get into all of that. But first, let me tell you why this matters.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Yeah, we'll get into all of that. But first, let me tell you why this matters. The Ra Material isn't just another channeling text. It's precise, it's consistent, and it maps onto physics, consciousness research, and ancient spiritual traditions in ways that are... unsettling. In a good way.
content.previous_text: Okay, hold up. Sixth-density social memory complex? You're gonna have to unpack that. And Venus? Like, the planet that's hot enough to melt lead?
content.next_text: Unsettling how?

content.speaker: Lenny

content.previous_text: The Ra Material isn't just another channeling text. It's precise, it's consistent, and it maps onto physics, consciousness research, and ancient spiritual traditions in ways that are... unsettling. In a good way.
content.next_text: Like, Ra talks about things in 1981 that science didn't confirm until decades later.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Like, Ra talks about things in 1981 that science didn't confirm until decades later. Quantum entanglement. The holographic nature of the universe. The role of consciousness in shaping reality. And Ra does it with this calm, almost clinical precision—like it's just describing how things are.
content.previous_text: Unsettling how?
content.next_text: Okay, so you're saying this thing predicted the future?

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: Okay, so you're saying this thing predicted the future? Or it just got lucky?
content.previous_text: Like, Ra talks about things in 1981 that science didn't confirm until decades later. Quantum entanglement. The holographic nature of the universe. The role of consciousness in shaping reality.
content.next_text: That's what we're going to explore.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: That's what we're going to explore. Over the next thirty-four episodes, we're going to break down the Ra Material—session by session, concept by concept. We're going to look at what Ra said, what science says, and whether any of it holds up. And we're going to tell the human story behind it—because this wasn't just an intellectual exercise. It cost them everything.
content.previous_text: Okay, so you're saying this thing predicted the future? Or it just got lucky?

content.speaker: Narrator
content.text: Don Elkins was a physics professor and a pilot. A man who spent his life asking questions that most people were afraid to ask. He'd been researching UFOs and paranormal phenomena since the 1950s, conducting experiments, interviewing witnesses, and collecting data. He wasn't a mystic. He was a scientist looking for patterns.
content.previous_text: We'll get there. But first, let's start at the beginning. Who were these three people? How did they make contact? And what did Ra actually say?
content.next_text: Carla Rueckert was a channel—what some people call a trance medium.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.text: Carla Rukert was a channel—what some people call a trance medium. She'd been channeling since the early 1970s, bringing through messages from various sources. But she was careful, disciplined, and deeply committed to service. She wasn't interested in fame or fortune. She wanted to help.
content.previous_text: Don Elkins was a physics professor and a pilot. A man who spent his life asking questions that most people were afraid to ask.
content.next_text: Jim McCarty was the scribe.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.text: Jim McCarty was the scribe. Quiet, steady, grounded. He documented everything, maintained the space, and kept the energy balanced. Without Jim, the circuit wouldn't have held.
content.previous_text: Carla Rueckert was a channel—what some people call a trance medium. She'd been channeling since the early 1970s, bringing through messages from various sources.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Kind of, yeah. Ra describes it as an energy circuit. Three people, three roles, creating a stable flow. Don was the questioner—his focus and intent directed the contact. Carla was the instrument—she offered her body and consciousness as the channel. Jim was the anchor—he grounded the energy and protected the space. Together, they created something none of them could do alone.
content.previous_text: So wait, you said circuit. What does that mean? Like, electrical circuit?

content.next_text: Exactly. And Ra says this wasn't random.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Exactly. And Ra says this wasn't random. These three were uniquely aligned—not just in purpose, but in polarity. They were all oriented toward service to others, and they'd been working together for years, refining their process. By the time Ra showed up, they were ready.
content.previous_text: Okay, so it's like a tripod. Three legs. You take one away, the whole thing collapses.
content.next_text: Hold on. Polarity? What's that?

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: Hold on. Polarity? What's that?
content.previous_text: These three were uniquely aligned—not just in purpose, but in polarity. They were all oriented toward service to others, and they'd been working together for years, refining their process.
content.next_text: Okay, so this is huge. Polarity is one of Ra's core concepts.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Okay, so this is huge. Polarity is one of Ra's core concepts. According to Ra, all conscious beings eventually choose a path: service to others, or service to self. It's not good versus evil—it's orientation. It's how you relate to the universe and everyone in it.
content.previous_text: Hold on. Polarity? What's that?
content.next_text: So like, light side versus dark side? Jedi versus Sith?

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: So like, light side versus dark side? Jedi versus Sith?
content.previous_text: According to Ra, all conscious beings eventually choose a path: service to others, or service to self. It's not good versus evil—it's orientation.
content.next_text: Kind of, but Ra's version is more nuanced.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Kind of, but Ra's version is more nuanced. Service to self isn't evil—it's a valid path of evolution. It's about control, power, and separation. Service to others is about unity, compassion, and giving. Both paths can lead to higher consciousness, but they get there in completely different ways. And here's the kicker: you have to choose. You can't sit in the middle forever.
content.previous_text: So like, light side versus dark side? Jedi versus Sith?
content.next_text: Wait, so you're saying even the bad guys can ascend?

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: Wait, so you're saying even the bad guys can ascend? Like, Darth Vader could just... keep going?
content.previous_text: Service to self isn't evil—it's a valid path of evolution. Both paths can lead to higher consciousness, but they get there in completely different ways. And here's the kicker: you have to choose.
content.next_text: If he committed hard enough to service to self, yeah. Ra says you need ninety-five percent service to self to polarize that way.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: If he committed hard enough to service to self, yeah. Ra says you need ninety-five percent service to self to polarize that way. It's ruthless. It's total domination, total control. Most people can't sustain it. But if you do, you evolve. Just... in a very different direction.
content.previous_text: Wait, so you're saying even the bad guys can ascend? Like, Darth Vader could just... keep going?
content.next_text: That's wild. So Don, Carla, and Jim—they were all service to others?

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Completely. That's why Ra could work with them. Ra is sixth-density, which means they're way beyond polarity—they've unified both paths. But to make contact with third-density beings like us, they need a compatible frequency. Don, Carla, and Jim were all aligned in service to others, so the circuit was clean. No interference.
content.previous_text: That's wild. So Don, Carla, and Jim—they were all service to others?

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: Okay, I'm starting to get it. So what happened on January 15th?
content.previous_text: Ra is sixth-density, which means they're way beyond polarity—they've unified both paths. But to make contact with third-density beings like us, they need a compatible frequency.
content.next_text: They sat down for what they thought would be a normal channeling session.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: They sat down for what they thought would be a normal channeling session. Carla went into trance. Don started asking questions. And then... something different came through. The voice was different. The energy was different. And the first thing it said was this.
content.previous_text: Okay, I'm starting to get it. So what happened on January 15th?
content.next_text: I am Ra. I am one of the members of the Confederation of Planets in the Service of the Infinite Creator.

content.speaker: Ra
content.text: I am Ra. I am one of the members of the Confederation of Planets in the Service of the Infinite Creator.
content.previous_text: They sat down for what they thought would be a normal channeling session. Carla went into trance. Don started asking questions. And then... something different came through.

content.text: Okay, pause. Confederation of Planets? Are we talking Star Trek here? Like, the Federation?
content.previous_text: I am Ra. I am one of the members of the Confederation of Planets in the Service of the Infinite Creator.
content.next_text: Basically, yeah. Ra describes the Confederation as a loose alliance of higher-density beings—planets, social memory complexes, all working together to help lower-density beings evolve.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Basically, yeah. Ra describes the Confederation as a loose alliance of higher-density beings—planets, social memory complexes, all working together to help lower-density beings evolve. But here's the thing: they can't interfere directly. They have rules. Ra calls it the Law of Confusion.
content.previous_text: Okay, pause. Confederation of Planets? Are we talking Star Trek here? Like, the Federation?
content.next_text: Law of Confusion? What does that mean?

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: Law of Confusion? What does that mean?
content.previous_text: Ra describes the Confederation as a loose alliance of higher-density beings—planets, social memory complexes, all working together to help lower-density beings evolve. But here's the thing: they can't interfere directly.
content.next_text: It's basically the Prime Directive.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: It's basically the Prime Directive. Ra says that if higher beings interfere too directly with our free will, they damage our evolution. We have to make our own choices, our own mistakes, our own discoveries. Ra can offer information to those who ask—like Don, Carla, and Jim—but they can't force anything. The choice always has to be ours.
content.previous_text: Law of Confusion? What does that mean?
content.next_text: So they can't just land on the White House lawn and fix everything.

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: So they can't just land on the White House lawn and fix everything. Even if they wanted to.
content.previous_text: Ra says that if higher beings interfere too directly with our free will, they damage our evolution. We have to make our own choices, our own mistakes, our own discoveries.
content.next_text: Right. And Ra says they learned this the hard way.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Right. And Ra says they learned this the hard way. Thousands of years ago, Ra tried to help humanity directly—they showed up in Egypt, tried to teach the Law of One. And it backfired. People turned Ra's teachings into a religion, into hierarchy, into control. Ra says they've been trying to balance that distortion ever since.
content.previous_text: So they can't just land on the White House lawn and fix everything. Even if they wanted to.

content.previous_text: Thousands of years ago, Ra tried to help humanity directly—they showed up in Egypt, tried to teach the Law of One. And it backfired. People turned Ra's teachings into a religion, into hierarchy, into control.
content.next_text: Okay, so this is where it gets really interesting.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Okay, so this is where it gets really interesting. Ra uses the word distortion constantly. And at first, it sounds negative, right? Like something's wrong. But Ra says distortion is just... reality. The moment the Infinite Creator—the One—decides to experience itself, it creates distortion. Separation. Individuality. You, me, this conversation—it's all distortion.
content.previous_text: Wait, distortion? That's another Ra word, right? What does that mean?
content.next_text: So distortion isn't bad. It's just... not the original unity.

content.speaker: Lenny
content.text: So distortion isn't bad. It's just... not the original unity.
content.previous_text: Ra uses the word distortion constantly. And at first, it sounds negative, right? Like something's wrong. But Ra says distortion is just... reality.
content.next_text: You Bet. Ra says the first distortion is free will.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: You Bet. Ra says the first distortion is free will. The Creator gives itself the freedom to choose, to explore, to become. The second distortion is love—not romantic love, but the creative principle, the desire to know and be known. And the third distortion is light—the building block of everything, the tool the Creator uses to experience itself.
content.previous_text: So distortion isn't bad. It's just... not the original unity.
content.next_text: Okay, so free will, love, light. That's the foundation.

content.next_text: Yeah, for starters.. And from there, Ra describes this whole cosmology—densities, planets, galaxies, consciousness evolving through different stages.

content.speaker: Victor
content.text: Yeah, for starters.. And from there, Ra describes this whole cosmology—densities, planets, galaxies, consciousness evolving through different stages. We're in third density right now, which is the density of self-awareness and choice. This is where we decide: service to self, or service to others. And that choice determines everything that comes next.
content.previous_text: Okay, so free will, love, light. That's the foundation. Everything else is built on top of that?

content.text: According to Ra, absolutely. We're at the end of a cycle. Earth is transitioning from third density to fourth density—the density of love and understanding. But not everyone is ready. Some people will graduate to fourth density. Some will repeat third density on another planet. And some... well, Ra says some are here specifically to help with the transition.

content.text: Ra calls them Wanderers. Souls from higher densities—fourth, fifth, sixth—who volunteer to incarnate here, in third density, to help. They forget who they are when they're born, just like everyone else. But they carry this... resonance. This sense that they don't quite belong here. content.text: Ra said: I am Ra. I have not spoken through this instrument before. We had to wait until she was precisely tuned, as we send a narrow-band vibration. And then Ra said: We are those of the Confederation who, eleven thousand of your years ago, came to two of your planetary cultures which were at that time closely in touch with the creation of the One Creator.
content.previous_text: We start with Session One. January 15th, 1981. The first time Ra spoke through Carla. What did Ra say?

And they've been trying to correct that distortion ever since.
content.previous_text: Eleven thousand years ago. So we're talking ancient Egypt? The pyramids?

content.speaker: Narrator
content.text: On January 15th, 1981, three people sat down in a small house in Louisville, Kentucky, and opened a door. They didn't know where it would lead. They didn't know what it would cost. But they asked the question anyway.
content.previous_text: See you next time.
content.next_text: And Ra answered.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.text: And Ra answered. For three years, across 106 sessions, Ra spoke. About the nature of reality. The structure of the universe. The purpose of existence. The choice we all face. And when it was over, the world had something it had never had before: a map. A guide. A distortion.

content.next_text: This is Distortion Check.

content.text: This is Distortion Check. A journey through the Ra Material. A search for truth in a sea of questions. And an honest attempt to answer the oldest question of all: What is real?
